meanings.definition: Holding firmly to an opinion or course of action; stubborn.
meanings.sent1: She was pertinacious in her belief that dogs make the best pets.
meanings.sent2: Despite the challenges, he remained pertinacious in his decision to pursue his dream.
meanings.sent3: The pertinacious squirrel refused to share its acorns with the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her pertinacious dedication to her studies was like a rock in the storm of distractions.
meanings.sent5: The image of the pertinacious old tree standing tall in the face of the harsh winds stayed with him.

meanings.definition: Continuing firmly in a course of action despite difficulty or opposition.
meanings.sent1: The pertinacious student kept studying even when the material seemed too hard.
meanings.sent2: The team showed a pertinacious effort in the final minutes of the game.
meanings.sent3: The pertinacious chef refused to give up on perfecting his signature dish.
meanings.sent4: Her pertinacious determination to reach the mountain peak inspired everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The pertinacious river flowed steadily through the rocky terrain, never deviating from its path.
